credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Design for ceiling decoration
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, red ink at upper edge (*check this*)
description: Horizontal rectangle. A variation of the scheme of -1532. The arch at left is reduced to a narrow strip. The central motif below is a circular medallion with a seated man, carried by the wings of two crouched griffins and supported by women seated upon the pointed arches. A spherical panel at left is decorated with an ovoidal medallion supported by seated women. Above is a view similar to that in -1524 with what probably means a trellis architecture in the center.
name: Drawing
